      • verifyLoginUser

        public void verifyLoginUser(User user,
                            java.lang.String nickname)
                     throws ObjectNotInTheDatabaseException
        This method is used when a user wants to log in the app (via the Login View). It checks the user is registered in the database (thanks to its nickname).

        Parameters:
        nickname - (a String giving the nickname of the user), User
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        ObjectNotInTheDatabaseException

      • getUserData

        public User getUserData(java.lang.String nickname)
        This method is used when a user wants to get its data, for example if it wants to modify them. It creates a user and fill all its data which are in the database (thanks to its nickname). The nickname argument specifies the user and must be a String.

        Parameters:
        nickname - (a String giving the nickname of the user)
        Returns:
        User
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • createUser

        public void createUser(java.lang.String nickname,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String email)
        This method is used when an admin registers a user. It creates the user into the database (thanks to its nickname). The nickname argument specifies the user and must be a String.

        Parameters:
        nickname - (a String giving the nickname of the user), password (a String giving the password of the user), e-mail (a String giving the e-mail of the user)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        This method is used when an admin modifies a user or when a user wants to modify its data. It modifies the user data into the database (thanks to its nickname). The nickname argument specifies the user and must be a String.

        Parameters:
        nickname - (a String giving the nickname of the user), password (a String giving the password of the user), e-mail (a String giving the e-mail of the user), first name (a String giving the first name of the user), last name (a String giving the last name of the user), city (a String giving the city of the user), street (a String giving the street of the user), postal code (a String giving the postal code of the user), street number (a String giving the street number of the user)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • isAdmin

        public boolean isAdmin(java.lang.String nickname)
        This method is used to know if a user is an admin. It seeks the user into the "admin" table in the database (thanks to its nickname). The nickname argument specifies the user and must be a String.

        Parameters:
        nickname - (a String giving the nickname of the user),
        Returns:
        boolean (true if the user is an admin, else false)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
